intro: Waltheria haenkeana, commonly known as the yellow balsam, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Waltheria haenkeana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ease of cultivation.
